definition: mail room/radio room (i.e. reception and transmission)
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy
surname Shi

sentences.english: So in a traditional mailroom, again the paper comes in, letters come in on mail.
sentences.chinese: 所以在傳統的收發室作業中，有紙質的文件，有信件。

sentences.english: Now, we'll go to the post room first with the letters.
sentences.chinese: 來，我們先把這些信件送到收發室。

sentences.english: Next thing is, the mail room is a pigsty.
sentences.chinese: 下一件事，收發室像個豬圈。

sentences.english: Could you tell me the telephone Number for the mail office?
sentences.chinese: 請你告訴我收發室的電話號碼好嗎？

sentences.english: Three envelopes, all marked Private and Confidential, had come through the mailroom.
sentences.chinese: 三封標明“密件親啓”的外寄信件送到了郵件收發室。

sentences.english: Many success stories at big corporations started began in the mail room.
sentences.chinese: 很多在大公司誕生的成功故事都開始於收發室。

sentences.english: What do you hope to get out of being in the mail room?
sentences.chinese: 你希望怎麼才能擺脫在郵件收發室？

sentences.english: They assigned the new worker to the mail room.
sentences.chinese: 新來的職工被安排到郵件收發室了。

statement of account

lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities

IOU/informal document acknowledging a debt
extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
order number
